Pre-Game Insights: The first semi-final of the T20 World Cup is between New Zealand and Pakistan on November 9, 2022, at the Sydney Cricket Ground.
New Zealand's underdog tag is perennial despite their consistent performance in World Cups.
Pakistan's journey to the semi-finals evoked the spirit of their 1992 World Cup triumph.
Pakistan hold the edge over New Zealand in their T20 head-to-head record, having won 17 of the 28 matches.
New Zealand's top order includes Glenn Phillips, Finn Allen, and Devon Conway, with Kane Williamson showing signs of returning to form.
Pakistan's star openers Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam have struggled for fluency, but players like Iftikhar Ahmed, Shan Masood, and Shadab Khan have stepped up.
Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf, and Mohamad Wasim form Pakistan's formidable pace attack.
New Zealand's pace attack includes Tim Southee, Trent Boult, and Lockie Ferguson.
